creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture; formerly given to the Center by H. Ed Robison, in memory of his beloved wife Ulrike Pietzner Robison
description: scene of the Kamo River in Kyoto: riverbank in foreground and middle ground with river running through; willow tree branches in foreground at L; silhouettes of trees in background at R, and riverfront buildings in background at L
marks: left: 自摺　昭和八年作　加茂川 {jizuri, Shōwa hachinen saku, K LRC: よし田 {Yoshida}
medium: Woodblock print; ink and color on paper
title: The Kamo River
